item.name: Absolute Grace
item.text: All creatures have protection from black.
item.flavorText: In pursuit of Urza, the Phyrexians sent countless foul legions into Serra's realm. Though beaten back, they left it tainted with uncleansable evil.

item.name: Absolute Law
item.text: All creatures have protection from red.
item.flavorText: The strength of law is unwavering. It is an iron bar in a world of water.

item.name: Angelic Chorus
item.text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, you gain life equal to its toughness.
item.flavorText: The very young and the very old know best the song the angels sing.

item.name: Angelic Page
item.text: Flying {T}: Target attacking or blocking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: If only every message were as perfect as its bearers.

item.name: Brilliant Halo
item.text: Enchant creature Enchanted creature gets +1/+2. When Brilliant Halo is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Brilliant Halo to its owner's hand.

item.name: Catastrophe
item.text: Destroy all lands or all creatures. Creatures destroyed this way can't be regenerated.
item.flavorText: Radiant's eyes flashed. "Go, then," the angel spat at Serra, "and leave this world to those who truly care."

item.name: Clear
item.text: Destroy target enchantment. Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

item.name: Congregate
item.text: Target player gains 2 life for each creature on the battlefield.
item.flavorText: "In the gathering there is strength for all who founder, renewal for all who languish, love for all who sing." —Song of All, canto 642

item.name: Defensive Formation
item.text: Rather than the attacking player, you assign the combat damage of each creature attacking you. You can divide that creature's combat damage as you choose among any of the creatures blocking it.
item.flavorText: "Your enemies will pound upon the door of your defenses, but only you shall have the key, and it is the key of life." —Song of All, canto 873

item.name: Disciple of Grace
item.text: Protection from black Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
item.flavorText: Beauty is beyond law.

item.name: Disciple of Law
item.text: Protection from red Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
item.flavorText: A religious order for religious order.

item.name: Disenchant
item.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
item.flavorText: "Let Phyrexia breed evil in the darkness; my holy light will reveal its taint." —Serra

item.name: Elite Archers
item.text: {T}: Elite Archers deals 3 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
item.flavorText: Arrows fletched with the feathers of angels seldom miss their mark.

item.name: Faith Healer
item.text: Sacrifice an enchantment: You gain life equal to the sacrificed enchantment's converted mana cost.
item.flavorText: The power of faith is quiet. It is the leaf unmoved by the hurricane.

item.name: Glorious Anthem
item.text: Creatures you control get +1/+1.
item.flavorText: Once heard, the battle song of an angel becomes part of the listener forever.

item.name: Healing Salve
item.text: Choose one — Target player gains 3 life; or prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
item.flavorText: "Xantcha is recovering. The medicine is slow, but my magic would have killed her." —Serra, to Urza

item.name: Herald of Serra
item.text: Flying, vigilance Echo {2}{W}{W} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)

item.name: Humble
item.text: Target creature loses all abilities and becomes 0/1 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "It is not your place to rule, Radiant. It may not even be mine." —Serra

item.name: Intrepid Hero
item.text: {T}: Destroy target creature with power 4 or greater.
item.flavorText: "We each have our own strengths, Radiant," Serra said with a sly smile. "If all of my people were like this one, who would carry your scrolls?"

item.name: Monk Idealist
item.text: When Monk Idealist enters the battlefield, return target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.
item.flavorText: "Belief is the strongest mortar."

item.name: Monk Realist
item.text: When Monk Realist enters the battlefield, destroy target enchantment.
item.flavorText: "We plant the seeds of doubt to harvest the crop of wisdom."

item.name: Opal Acrolith
item.text: Whenever an opponent casts a creature spell, if Opal Acrolith is an enchantment, Opal Acrolith becomes a 2/4 Soldier creature. {0}: Opal Acrolith becomes an enchantment.

item.name: Opal Archangel
item.text: When an opponent casts a creature spell, if Opal Archangel is an enchantment, Opal Archangel becomes a 5/5 Angel creature with flying and vigilance.

item.name: Opal Caryatid
item.text: When an opponent casts a creature spell, if Opal Caryatid is an enchantment, Opal Caryatid becomes a 2/2 Soldier creature.

item.name: Opal Gargoyle
item.text: When an opponent casts a creature spell, if Opal Gargoyle is an enchantment, Opal Gargoyle becomes a 2/2 Gargoyle creature with flying.

item.name: Opal Titan
item.text: When an opponent casts a creature spell, if Opal Titan is an enchantment, Opal Titan becomes a 4/4 Giant creature with protection from each of that spell's colors.

item.name: Pacifism
item.text: Enchant creature Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
item.flavorText: "Fight? I cannot. I do not care if I live or die, so long as I can rest." —Urza, to Serra

item.name: Pariah
item.text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.) All damage that would be dealt to you is dealt to enchanted creature instead.
item.flavorText: "It is not sad," Radiant chided the lesser angel. "It is right. Every society must have its outcasts."

item.name: Path of Peace
item.text: Destroy target creature. Its owner gains 4 life.
item.flavorText: "When the sword becomes a burden, let the warrior lay it aside that another with a truer heart might take it up." —Radiant, archangel

item.name: Pegasus Charger
item.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.) First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
item.flavorText: "The clouds came alive and dove to the earth Hooves flashed among the dark army, who fled before the spectacle of fury." —Song of All, canto 211

item.name: Planar Birth
item.text: Return all basic land cards from all graveyards to the battlefield tapped under their owners' control.
item.flavorText: "From womb of nothingness sprang this place of beauty, purity, and hope realized." —Song of All, canto 3

item.name: Presence of the Master
item.text: Whenever a player casts an enchantment spell, counter it.
item.flavorText: Peace to all. Peace be all. —Great Hall floor inscription

item.name: Redeem
item.text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt this turn to up to two target creatures.
item.flavorText: "That they are saved from death is immaterial. What is important is that they know the source of their benefaction." —Radiant, archangel

item.name: Remembrance
item.text: Whenever a nontoken creature you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may search your library for a card with the same name as that creature, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

item.name: Rune of Protection: Artifacts
item.text: {W}: The next time an artifact source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

item.name: Rune of Protection: Black
item.text: {W}: The next time a black source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

item.name: Rune of Protection: Blue
item.text: {W}: The next time a blue source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

item.name: Rune of Protection: Green
item.text: {W}: The next time a green source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

item.name: Rune of Protection: Lands
item.text: {W}: The next time a land source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

item.name: Rune of Protection: Red
item.text: {W}: The next time a red source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

item.name: Rune of Protection: White
item.text: {W}: The next time a white source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

item.name: Sanctum Custodian
item.text: {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
item.flavorText: Serra told them to guard Urza as he healed. Five years they stood.

item.name: Sanctum Guardian
item.text: Sacrifice Sanctum Guardian: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature or player this turn, prevent that damage.
item.flavorText: "Protect our mother in her womb."

item.name: Seasoned Marshal
item.text: Whenever Seasoned Marshal attacks, you may tap target creature.
item.flavorText: There are only two rules of tactics: never be without a plan, and never rely on it.

item.name: Serra Avatar
item.text: Serra Avatar's power and toughness are each equal to your life total. When Serra Avatar is put into a graveyard from anywhere, shuffle it into its owner's library.

item.name: Serra Zealot
item.text: First strike
item.flavorText: "The humans are useful in their way, but they must be commanded as the builder commands the stone. Be soft with them, and they will become soft."—Radiant, archangel

item.name: Serra's Embrace
item.text: Enchant creature Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has flying and vigilance.
item.flavorText: "Lifted beyond herself, for that battle Brindri was an angel of light and fury." —Song of All, canto 524

item.name: Serra's Hymn
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a verse counter on Serra's Hymn. Sacrifice Serra's Hymn: Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt this turn to any number of target creatures and/or players, divided as you choose, where X is the number of verse counters on Serra's Hymn.

item.name: Serra's Liturgy
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a verse counter on Serra's Liturgy. {W}, Sacrifice Serra's Liturgy: Destroy up to X target artifacts and/or enchantments, where X is the number of verse counters on Serra's Liturgy.

item.name: Shimmering Barrier
item.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.) First strike Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

item.name: Silent Attendant
item.text: {T}: You gain 1 life.
item.flavorText: "The answer to life should never be death; it should always be more life, wrapped tight around us like precious silks."

item.name: Songstitcher
item.text: {1}{W}: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn by target attacking creature with flying.
item.flavorText: The true names of birds are songs woven into their souls.

item.name: Soul Sculptor
item.text: {1}{W}, {T}: Target creature becomes an enchantment and loses all abilities until a player casts a creature spell.
item.flavorText: Does the stone mimic life, or did it once live?

item.name: Voice of Grace
item.text: Flying, protection from black
item.flavorText: "Opposite Law is Grace, and Grace must be preserved. If the strands of Grace are unraveled, its design will be lost, and the people with it." —Song of All, canto 167

item.name: Voice of Law
item.text: Flying, protection from red
item.flavorText: "Life's balance is as a star: on one point is Law, and Law must be upheld. If the knots of order are loosened, chaos will spill through." —Song of All, canto 167

item.name: Waylay
item.text: Put three 2/2 white Knight creature tokens onto the battlefield. Exile them at the beginning of the next cleanup step.
item.flavorText: "You reek of corruption," spat the knight. "Why are you even here?"

item.name: Worship
item.text: If you control a creature, damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 reduces it to 1 instead.
item.flavorText: "Believe in the ideal, not the idol." —Serra

item.name: Academy Researchers
item.text: When Academy Researchers enters the battlefield, you may put an Aura card from your hand onto the battlefield attached to Academy Researchers.

item.name: Annul
item.text: Counter target artifact or enchantment spell.
item.flavorText: The most effective way to destroy a spell is to ensure it was never cast in the first place.

item.name: Arcane Laboratory
item.text: Each player can't cast more than one spell each turn.
item.flavorText: It soon became obvious that some experiments were best overseen by fireproof teachers.

item.name: Attunement
item.text: Return Attunement to its owner's hand: Draw three cards, then discard four cards.
item.flavorText: "The solution can hide for only so long." —Urza

item.name: Back to Basics
item.text: Nonbasic lands don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
item.flavorText: "A ruler wears a crown while the rest of us wear hats, but which would you rather have when it's raining?" —Barrin, Principia

item.name: Barrin, Master Wizard
item.text: {2}, Sacrifice a permanent: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
item.flavorText: "Knowledge is no more expensive than ignorance, and at least as satisfying." —Barrin, master wizard

item.name: Catalog
item.text: Draw two cards, then discard a card.
item.flavorText: "Without order comes errors, and errors kill on Tolaria." —Barrin, master wizard

item.name: Cloak of Mists
item.text: Enchant creature Enchanted creature is unblockable.
item.flavorText: "All we could lose, we did. All we could keep, we do. And both are shrouded by mists." —Barrin, master wizard

item.name: Confiscate
item.text: Enchant permanent (Target a permanent as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that permanent.) You control enchanted permanent.
item.flavorText: "I don't understand why he works so hard on a device to duplicate a sound so easily made with hand and armpit." —Barrin, progress report

item.name: Coral Merfolk
item.flavorText: It is not unusual for a single family of coral merfolk to spend centuries carefully guiding the growth of the reefs where they make their home.

item.name: Curfew
item.text: Each player returns a creature he or she controls to its owner's hand.
item.flavorText: ". . . But I'm not tired"

item.name: Disruptive Student
item.text: {T}: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.
item.flavorText: "Teferi is a problem student. Always late for class. No appreciation for constructive use of time." —Barrin, progress report

item.name: Douse
item.text: {1}{U}: Counter target red spell.
item.flavorText: The academy's libraries were protected by fire-prevention spells. Even after the disaster, the books were intact—though forever sealed in time.

item.name: Drifting Djinn
item.text: Flying At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Drifting Djinn unless you pay {1}{U}. Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

item.name: Enchantment Alteration
item.text: Attach target Aura attached to a creature or land to another permanent of that type.

item.name: Energy Field
item.text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you by sources you don't control. When a card is put into your graveyard from anywhere, sacrifice Energy Field.

item.name: Exhaustion
item.text: Creatures and lands target opponent controls don't untap during his or her next untap step.
item.flavorText: The mage felt as though he'd been in the stasis suit for days. Upon his return, he found it was months.

item.name: Fog Bank
item.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.) Flying Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by Fog Bank.

item.name: Gilded Drake
item.text: Flying When Gilded Drake enters the battlefield, exchange control of Gilded Drake and up to one target creature an opponent controls. If you don't make an exchange, sacrifice Gilded Drake. This ability can't be countered except by spells and abilities. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
item.flavorText: Buyer beware.

item.name: Great Whale
item.text: When Great Whale enters the battlefield, untap up to seven lands.
item.flavorText: "As a great whale dies, it flips onto its back. And so an island is born." —Mariners' legend

item.name: Hermetic Study
item.text: Enchant creature Enchanted creature has "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to target creature or player."
item.flavorText: "Books can be replaced; a prize student cannot. Be patient." —Urza, to Barrin

item.name: Hibernation
item.text: Return all green permanents to their owners' hands.
item.flavorText: On its way to the cave, the armadillo brushed by a sapling. It awoke to find a full-grown tree blocking its path.

item.name: Horseshoe Crab
item.text: {U}: Untap Horseshoe Crab.
item.flavorText: In the final days before the disaster, all the crabs on Tolaria migrated from inlets, streams, and ponds back to the sea. No one took note.

item.name: Imaginary Pet
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have a card in hand, return Imaginary Pet to its owner's hand.
item.flavorText: "It followed me home. Can I keep it?"

item.name: Launch
item.text: Enchant creature Enchanted creature has flying. When Launch is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Launch to its owner's hand.

item.name: Lilting Refrain
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a verse counter on Lilting Refrain. Sacrifice Lilting Refrain: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}, where X is the number of verse counters on Lilting Refrain.

item.name: Lingering Mirage
item.text: Enchant land Enchanted land is an Island. Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
item.flavorText: Birds frozen in flight. Sea turned to glass. Tolaria hidden in a mirror.

item.name: Morphling
item.text: {U}: Untap Morphling. {U}: Morphling gains flying until end of turn. {U}: Morphling gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.) {1}: Morphling gets +1/-1 until end of turn. {1}: Morphling gets -1/+1 until end of turn.

item.name: Pendrell Drake
item.text: Flying Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
item.flavorText: The mages of Tolaria found strange ways to spend their free time. Occasionally they had contests to see whose kite was eaten last.

item.name: Pendrell Flux
item.text: Enchant creature Enchanted creature has "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this creature unless you pay its mana cost."
item.flavorText: Devoured by the mists, Tolaria was stuck in time, trapped between two eternal heartbeats.

item.name: Peregrine Drake
item.text: Flying When Peregrine Drake enters the battlefield, untap up to five lands.
item.flavorText: That the Tolarian mists parted for the drakes was warning enough to stay away.

item.name: Power Sink
item.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. If he or she doesn't, that player taps all lands with mana abilities he or she controls and empties his or her mana pool.

item.name: Power Taint
item.text: Enchant enchantment At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted enchantment's controller, that player loses 2 life unless he or she pays {2}. Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

item.name: Recantation
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a verse counter on Recantation. {U}, Sacrifice Recantation: Return up to X target permanents to their owners' hands, where X is the number of verse counters on Recantation.

item.name: Rescind
item.text: Return target permanent to its owner's hand. Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

item.name: Rewind
item.text: Counter target spell. Untap up to four lands.
item.flavorText: "Time flows like a river. In Tolaria we practice the art of building dams." —Barrin, master wizard

item.name: Sandbar Merfolk
item.text: Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
item.flavorText: You are not prey until a predator knows of your existence.

item.name: Sandbar Serpent
item.text: Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
item.flavorText: Treacherous and unpredictable currents around Tolaria earned the nickname "serpent wakes."

item.name: Show and Tell
item.text: Each player may put an artifact, creature, enchantment, or land card from his or her hand onto the battlefield.
item.flavorText: At the academy, "show and tell" too often becomes "run and hide."

item.name: Somnophore
item.text: Flying Whenever Somnophore deals damage to a player, tap target creature that player controls. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as Somnophore remains on the battlefield.

item.name: Spire Owl
item.text: Flying When Spire Owl enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

item.name: Stern Proctor
item.text: When Stern Proctor enters the battlefield, return target artifact or enchantment to its owner's hand.
item.flavorText: "I preferred the harsh tutors—they made mischief all the more fun." —Teferi, third-level student

item.name: Stroke of Genius
item.text: Target player draws X cards.
item.flavorText: After a hundred failed experiments, Urza was stunned to find that common silver passed through the portal undamaged. He immediately designed a golem made of the metal.

item.name: Sunder
item.text: Return all lands to their owners' hands.
item.flavorText: The flow of time was disrupted; like a flooding river it rose from its banks. Tolaria was drowned in an instant that stretched toward infinity.

item.name: Telepathy
item.text: Your opponents play with their hands revealed.
item.flavorText: "The most disappointing thing about learning telepathy is finding out how boring people really are." —Teferi, fourth-level student

item.name: Time Spiral
item.text: Exile Time Spiral. Each player shuffles his or her graveyard and hand into his or her library, then draws seven cards. You untap up to six lands.

item.name: Tolarian Winds
item.text: Discard all the cards in your hand, then draw that many cards.
item.flavorText: Afterward, Tolaria's winds were like the whispers of lost wizards, calling for life.

item.name: Turnabout
item.text: Choose artifact, creature, or land. Tap all untapped permanents of the chosen type target player controls, or untap all tapped permanents of that type that player controls.
item.flavorText: The best cure for a big ego is a little failure.

item.name: Veil of Birds
item.text: When an opponent casts a spell, if Veil of Birds is an enchantment, Veil of Birds becomes a 1/1 Bird creature with flying.
item.flavorText: When wind marries sky, even the bride's veil sings her praises.

item.name: Veiled Apparition
item.text: When an opponent casts a spell, if Veiled Apparition is an enchantment, Veiled Apparition becomes a 3/3 Illusion creature with flying and "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Veiled Apparition unless you pay {1}{U}."

item.name: Veiled Crocodile
item.text: When a player has no cards in hand, if Veiled Crocodile is an enchantment, Veiled Crocodile becomes a 4/4 Crocodile creature.
item.flavorText: Some roads are paved with bad intentions.

item.name: Veiled Sentry
item.text: When an opponent casts a spell, if Veiled Sentry is an enchantment, Veiled Sentry becomes an Illusion creature with power and toughness each equal to that spell's converted mana cost.

item.name: Veiled Serpent
item.text: When an opponent casts a spell, if Veiled Serpent is an enchantment, Veiled Serpent becomes a 4/4 Serpent creature that can't attack unless defending player controls an Island. Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

item.name: Windfall
item.text: Each player discards his or her hand, then draws cards equal to the greatest number of cards a player discarded this way.
item.flavorText: "To fill your mind with knowledge, we must start by emptying it." —Barrin, master wizard

item.name: Wizard Mentor
item.text: {T}: Return Wizard Mentor and target creature you control to their owner's hand.
item.flavorText: Although some of the students quickly grasped the concept, the others could summon only blackboards.

item.name: Zephid
item.text: Flying; shroud (This permanent can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
item.flavorText: Once you've seen one, you'll understand why spells won't go near them.

item.name: Zephid's Embrace
item.text: Enchant creature Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has flying and shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
item.flavorText: Spells will shun you, as will everyone else.

item.name: Abyssal Horror
item.text: Flying When Abyssal Horror enters the battlefield, target player discards two cards.
item.flavorText: It has no face of its own—it wears that of its latest victim.

item.name: Befoul
item.text: Destroy target land or nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
item.flavorText: "The land putrefied at its touch, turned into an oily bile in seconds." —Radiant, archangel

item.name: Bereavement
item.text: Whenever a green creature is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, its controller discards a card.
item.flavorText: "Grief is as useless as love." —Gix, Yawgmoth praetor

item.name: Blood Vassal
item.text: Sacrifice Blood Vassal: Add {B}{B} to your mana pool.
item.flavorText: "They are bred to suffer and born to die. Much like humans." —Gix, Yawgmoth praetor

item.name: Bog Raiders
item.text: Swampwalk
item.flavorText: "Let weak feed on weak, that we may divine the nature of strength." —Phyrexian Scriptures

item.name: Breach
item.text: Target creature gets +2/+0 and gains fear until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

item.name: Cackling Fiend
item.text: When Cackling Fiend enters the battlefield, each opponent discards a card.
item.flavorText: Its windpipe is only the first to amplify its maddening laughter.

item.name: Carrion Beetles
item.text: {2}{B}, {T}: Exile up to three target cards from a single graveyard.
item.flavorText: It's all fun and games until someone loses an eye.

item.name: Contamination
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Contamination unless you sacrifice a creature. If a land is tapped for mana, it produces {B} instead of any other type and amount.

item.name: Corrupt
item.text: Corrupt deals damage equal to the number of Swamps you control to target creature or player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.
item.flavorText: Yawgmoth brushed Urza's mind, and Urza's world convulsed.

item.name: Crazed Skirge
item.text: Flying, haste
item.flavorText: They are Phyrexia's couriers; the messages they carry are inscribed on their slick hides.

item.name: Dark Hatchling
item.text: Flying When Dark Hatchling enters the battlefield, destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

item.name: Dark Ritual
item.text: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.
item.flavorText: "From void evolved Phyrexia. Great Yawgmoth, Father of Machines, saw its perfection. Thus The Grand Evolution began." —Phyrexian Scriptures

item.name: Darkest Hour
item.text: All creatures are black.
item.flavorText: "Yawgmoth spent eons wrapping Phyrexians in human skin. They are the sleeper agents, and they are everywhere." —Xantcha, to Urza

item.name: Despondency
item.text: Enchant creature Enchanted creature gets -2/-0. When Despondency is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Despondency to its owner's hand.

item.name: Diabolic Servitude
item.text: When Diabolic Servitude enters the battlefield, return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. When the creature put onto the battlefield with Diabolic Servitude is put into a graveyard, exile it and return Diabolic Servitude to its owner's hand. When Diabolic Servitude leaves the battlefield, exile the creature put onto the battlefield with Diabolic Servitude.

item.name: Discordant Dirge
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a verse counter on Discordant Dirge. {B}, Sacrifice Discordant Dirge: Look at target opponent's hand and choose up to X cards from it, where X is the number of verse counters on Discordant Dirge. That player discards those cards.

item.name: Duress
item.text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.
item.flavorText: "We decide who is worthy of our works." —Gix, Yawgmoth praetor

item.name: Eastern Paladin
item.text: {B}{B}, {T}: Destroy target green creature.
item.flavorText: "Their fragile world. Their futile lives. They obstruct the Grand Evolution. In Yawgmoth's name, we shall excise them." —Oath of the East

item.name: Exhume
item.text: Each player puts a creature card from his or her graveyard onto the battlefield.
item.flavorText: "Death—an outmoded concept. We sleep, and we change." —Sitrik, birth priest

item.name: Expunge
item.text: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated. Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

item.name: Flesh Reaver
item.text: Whenever Flesh Reaver deals damage to a creature or opponent, Flesh Reaver deals that much damage to you.
item.flavorText: Though the reaver is horrifyingly effective, its dorsal vents spit a highly corrosive cloud of filth.

item.name: Hollow Dogs
item.text: Whenever Hollow Dogs attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: A hollow dog is never empty. It is filled with thirst for the hunt.

item.name: Ill-Gotten Gains
item.text: Exile Ill-Gotten Gains. Each player discards his or her hand, then returns up to three cards from his or her graveyard to his or her hand.
item.flavorText: Urza thought it a crusade. Xantcha knew it was a robbery.

item.name: Looming Shade
item.text: {B}: Looming Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: The shade tracks victims by reverberations of the pipes, as a spider senses prey tangled in its trembling web.

item.name: Lurking Evil
item.text: Pay half your life, rounded up: Lurking Evil becomes a 4/4 Horror creature with flying.
item.flavorText: "Ash is our air, darkness our flesh." —Phyrexian Scriptures

item.name: Mana Leech
item.text: You may choose not to untap Mana Leech during your untap step. {T}: Tap target land. It doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as Mana Leech remains tapped.

item.name: No Rest for the Wicked
item.text: Sacrifice No Rest for the Wicked: Return to your hand all creature cards in your graveyard that were put there from the battlefield this turn.
item.flavorText: "The soul? Here, we have no use for such frivolities." —Sitrik, birth priest

item.name: Oppression
item.text: Whenever a player casts a spell, that player discards a card.
item.flavorText: "Do not presume to speak for yourself." —Gix, to Xantcha

item.name: Order of Yawgmoth
item.text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.) Whenever Order of Yawgmoth deals damage to a player, that player discards a card.

item.name: Parasitic Bond
item.text: Enchant creature At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, Parasitic Bond deals 2 damage to that player.
item.flavorText: "All bonds are parasitic. Only rulership is pure." —Gix, Yawgmoth praetor

item.name: Persecute
item.text: Choose a color. Target player reveals his or her hand and discards all cards of that color.
item.flavorText: "My finest warrior was lost to the Phyrexians. I pray that Lady Selenia died honorably." —Radiant, archangel

item.name: Pestilence
item.text: At the beginning of the end step, if no creatures are on the battlefield, sacrifice Pestilence. {B}: Pestilence deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

item.name: Phyrexian Ghoul
item.text: Sacrifice a creature: Phyrexian Ghoul gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: Phyrexia wastes nothing. Its food chain is a spiraling cycle.

item.name: Planar Void
item.text: Whenever another card is put into a graveyard from anywhere, exile that card.
item.flavorText: "Planeswalking isn't about walking. It's about falling and screaming." —Xantcha, Phyrexian outcast

item.name: Priest of Gix
item.text: When Priest of Gix enters the battlefield, add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.
item.flavorText: "Gix doesn't want a people to rule but puppets to entertain his madness." —Xantcha, Phyrexian outcast

item.name: Rain of Filth
item.text: Until end of turn, lands you control gain "Sacrifice this land: Add {B} to your mana pool."
item.flavorText: "When I say it rained, it was not small drops, but a thick, greasy drool pouring from the heavens." —Urza, journal

item.name: Ravenous Skirge
item.text: Flying Whenever Ravenous Skirge attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: Hunger is a kind of madness—and here, all madness flourishes.

item.name: Reclusive Wight
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control another nonland permanent, sacrifice Reclusive Wight.
item.flavorText: There are places so horrible that even the dead hide their faces.

item.name: Reprocess
item.text: Sacrifice any number of artifacts, creatures, and/or lands. Draw a card for each permanent sacrificed this way.
item.flavorText: Everything will find its use in Phyrexia. Eventually.

item.name: Sanguine Guard
item.text: First strike {1}{B}: Regenerate Sanguine Guard.
item.flavorText: "Father of Machines Your filigree gaze carves us, and the scars dance upon our grateful flesh." —Phyrexian Scriptures

item.name: Sicken
item.text: Enchant creature Enchanted creature gets -1/-1. Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
item.flavorText: Urza dared to attack Phyrexia. Slowly, it retaliated.

item.name: Skirge Familiar
item.text: Flying Discard a card: Add {B} to your mana pool.
item.flavorText: The first Yawgmoth priest to harness their power was rewarded with several unique mutilations.

item.name: Skittering Skirge
item.text: Flying When you cast a creature spell, sacrifice Skittering Skirge.
item.flavorText: The imps' warbling cries echo through Phyrexia's towers like those of mourning doves in a cathedral.

item.name: Sleeper Agent
item.text: When Sleeper Agent enters the battlefield, target opponent gains control of it. At the beginning of your upkeep, Sleeper Agent deals 2 damage to you.

item.name: Spined Fluke
item.text: When Spined Fluke enters the battlefield, sacrifice a creature. {B}: Regenerate Spined Fluke.
item.flavorText: Its spines are prized as writing quills by the priests of Gix.

item.name: Tainted Æther
item.text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, its controller sacrifices a creature or land.
item.flavorText: Gix despised the sylvan morass. The gouge that the portal had torn in the forest was the only pleasing sight.

item.name: Unnerve
item.text: Each opponent discards two cards.
item.flavorText: "If fear is the only tool you have left, then you'll never control me." —Xantcha, to Gix

item.name: Unworthy Dead
item.text: {B}: Regenerate Unworthy Dead.
item.flavorText: "Great Yawgmoth moves across the seas of shard and bone and rust. We exalt him in life, in death, and in between." —Phyrexian Scriptures

item.name: Vampiric Embrace
item.text: Enchant creature Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has flying. Whenever a creature dealt damage by enchanted creature this turn is put into a graveyard, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature.

item.name: Vebulid
item.text: Vebulid enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Vebulid. When Vebulid attacks or blocks, destroy it at end of combat.

item.name: Victimize
item.text: Choose two target creature cards in your graveyard. Sacrifice a creature. If you do, return the chosen cards to the battlefield tapped.
item.flavorText: The priest cast Xantcha to the ground. "It is defective. We must scrap it."

item.name: Vile Requiem
item.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a verse counter on Vile Requiem.
{1}{B}, Sacrifice Vile Requiem: Destroy up to X target nonblack creatures, where X is the number of verse counters on Vile Requiem. They can't be regenerated.

item.name: Western Paladin
item.text: {B}{B}, {T}: Destroy target white creature.
item.flavorText: "Their weak laws. Their flawed systems. They inhibit the Grand Evolution. In Yawgmoth's name, we shall erase them." —Oath of the West

item.name: Witch Engine
item.text: Swampwalk {T}: Add {B}{B}{B}{B} to your mana pool. Target opponent gains control of Witch Engine. (Activate this ability only any time you could cast an instant.)

item.name: Yawgmoth's Edict
item.text: Whenever an opponent casts a white spell, that player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
item.flavorText: "Phyrexia's purity permits no other." —Xantcha, Phyrexian outcast

item.name: Yawgmoth's Will
item.text: Until end of turn, you may play cards from your graveyard. If a card would be put into your graveyard from anywhere this turn, exile that card instead.

item.name: Acidic Soil
item.text: Acidic Soil deals damage to each player equal to the number of lands he or she controls.
item.flavorText: Phyrexia had tried to take Urza's soul. He was relieved that Shiv tried to claim only his soles.

item.name: Antagonism
item.text: At the beginning of each player's end step, Antagonism deals 2 damage to that player unless one of his or her opponents was dealt damage this turn.

item.name: Arc Lightning
item.text: Arc Lightning deals 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three target creatures and/or players.
item.flavorText: Rainclouds don't last long in Shiv, but that doesn't stop the lightning.

item.name: Bedlam
item.text: Creatures can't block.
item.flavorText: Sometimes quantity, in the absence of quality, is good enough.

item.name: Brand
item.text: Gain control of all permanents you own. (This effect lasts indefinitely.) Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
item.flavorText: "By this glyph I affirm your role." —Urza, to Karn

item.name: Bravado
item.text: Enchant creature Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature you control.
item.flavorText: "We drive the dragons from our home. Why should we fear you?" —Fire Eye, viashino bey

item.name: Bulwark
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, Bulwark deals X damage to target opponent, where X is the number of cards in your hand minus the number of cards in that player's hand.
item.flavorText: "It will be the goblin's first bath, and its last." —Fire Eye, viashino bey

item.name: Crater Hellion
item.text: Echo {4}{R}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.) When Crater Hellion enters the battlefield, it deals 4 damage to each other creature.

item.name: Destructive Urge
item.text: Enchant creature Whenever enchanted creature deals combat damage to a player, that player sacrifices a land.
item.flavorText: Red sky at night, dragon's delight.

item.name: Disorder
item.text: Disorder deals 2 damage to each white creature and each player who controls a white creature.
item.flavorText: "Then, just when the other guys were winnin', the sky threw up." —Jula, goblin raider

item.name: Dromosaur
item.text: Whenever Dromosaur blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +2/-2 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: They say dromosaurs are frightened of dogs, even little ones. There are no dogs in Shiv. Not even little ones.

item.name: Electryte
item.text: Whenever Electryte deals combat damage to defending player, it deals damage equal to its power to each blocking creature.
item.flavorText: Shivan inhabitants are hardened to fire, so their predators have developed alternative weaponry.

item.name: Falter
item.text: Creatures without flying can't block this turn.
item.flavorText: Like a sleeping dragon, Shiv stirs and groans at times.

item.name: Fault Line
item.text: Fault Line deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.
item.flavorText: We live on the serpent's back. —Viashino saying

item.name: Fiery Mantle
item.text: Enchant creature {R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn. When Fiery Mantle is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Fiery Mantle to its owner's hand.

item.name: Fire Ants
item.text: {T}: Fire Ants deals 1 damage to each other creature without flying.
item.flavorText: Visitors to Shiv fear the dragons, the goblins, or the viashino. Natives fear the ants.

item.name: Gamble
item.text: Search your library for a card, put that card into your hand, discard a card at random, then shuffle your library.
item.flavorText: When you've got nothing, you might as well trade it for something else.

item.name: Goblin Cadets
item.text: Whenever Goblin Cadets blocks or becomes blocked, target opponent gains control of it. (This removes Goblin Cadets from combat.)
item.flavorText: "If you kids don't stop that racket, I'm turning this expedition around right now"

item.name: Goblin Lackey
item.text: Whenever Goblin Lackey deals damage to a player, you may put a Goblin permanent card from your hand onto the battlefield.
item.flavorText: All bark, someone else's bite.

item.name: Goblin Matron
item.text: When Goblin Matron enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Goblin card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
item.flavorText: There's always room for one more.

item.name: Goblin Offensive
item.text: Put X 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens onto the battlefield.
item.flavorText: They certainly are.

item.name: Goblin Patrol
item.text: Echo {R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
item.flavorText: "Take the sharp metal stick and make a lotta holes." —Jula, goblin raider

item.name: Goblin Raider
item.text: Goblin Raider can't block.
item.flavorText: He was proud to wear the lizard skin around his waist, just for the fun of annoying the enemy.

item.name: Goblin Spelunkers
item.text: Mountainwalk
item.flavorText: "It only short jump. You go first." "AIIIEEEE" "Hmm . . . we go different way now."

item.name: Goblin War Buggy
item.text: Haste Echo {1}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)

item.name: Guma
item.text: Protection from blue
item.flavorText: When the giant returned for the night, he found a dead merfolk on his pillow. Although he praised the little guma, he inwardly wondered where she had hid the head.

item.name: Headlong Rush
item.text: Attacking creatures gain first strike until end of turn.
item.flavorText: A landslide of goblins poured towards the defenders—tumbling, rolling, and bouncing their way down the steep hillside.

item.name: Heat Ray
item.text: Heat Ray deals X damage to target creature.
item.flavorText: It's not known whether the Thran built the device to forge their wonders or to defend them.

item.name: Jagged Lightning
item.text: Jagged Lightning deals 3 damage to each of two target creatures.
item.flavorText: The pungent smell of roasting flesh made both mages realize they'd rather break for dinner than fight.

item.name: Lay Waste
item.text: Destroy target land. Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

item.name: Lightning Dragon
item.text: Flying Echo {2}{R}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.) {R}: Lightning Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

item.name: Meltdown
item.text: Destroy each artifact with converted mana cost X or less.
item.flavorText: Catastrophes happened so often at the mana rig that the viashino language had a special word to describe them.

item.name: Okk
item.text: Okk can't attack unless a creature with greater power also attacks. Okk can't block unless a creature with greater power also blocks.

item.name: Outmaneuver
item.text: X target blocked creatures assign their combat damage this turn as though they weren't blocked.
item.flavorText: "Push one goblin into sight, an' run a lot. That's tactics." —Jula, goblin raider

item.name: Rain of Salt
item.text: Destroy two target lands.
item.flavorText: Here, rain does not wash the land; it desiccates it.

item.name: Raze
item.text: As an additional cost to cast Raze, sacrifice a land. Destroy target land.
item.flavorText: The viashino believe that the oldest mountains hate everyone equally.

item.name: Reflexes
item.text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.) Enchanted creature has first strike. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
item.flavorText: "Here's how ya win. Don't let the other guy hit back first." —Jula, goblin raider

item.name: Retromancer
item.text: Whenever Retromancer becomes the target of a spell or ability, Retromancer deals 3 damage to that spell or ability's controller.
item.flavorText: "If one harm us, strike them in return. So sayeth the bey."

item.name: Rumbling Crescendo
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a verse counter on Rumbling Crescendo. {R}, Sacrifice Rumbling Crescendo: Destroy up to X target lands, where X is the number of verse counters on Rumbling Crescendo.

item.name: Scald
item.text: Whenever a player taps an Island for mana, Scald deals 1 damage to that player.
item.flavorText: "Shiv may be surrounded by water, but the mountains go far deeper." —Fire Eye, viashino bey

item.name: Scoria Wurm
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, return Scoria Wurm to its owner's hand.
item.flavorText: Late at night, ululations echo from deep under Shiv, as the wurms sing of times older than humanity.

item.name: Scrap
item.text: Destroy target artifact. Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

item.name: Shiv's Embrace
item.text: Enchant creature Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has flying. {R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "Wear the foe's form to best it in battle. So sayeth the bey."

item.name: Shivan Hellkite
item.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.) {1}{R}: Shivan Hellkite deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
item.flavorText: A dragon's scale can be carved into a mighty shield, provided you can procure a dragontooth to cut it.

item.name: Shivan Raptor
item.text: First strike, haste Echo {2}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)

item.name: Shower of Sparks
item.text: Shower of Sparks deals 1 damage to target creature and 1 damage to target player.
item.flavorText: The viashino had learned how to operate the rig through trial and error—mostly error.

item.name: Sneak Attack
item.text: {R}: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield. That creature gains haste. Sacrifice the creature at the beginning of the next end step.
item.flavorText: "Nothin' beat surprise—'cept rock."

item.name: Steam Blast
item.text: Steam Blast deals 2 damage to each creature and each player.
item.flavorText: The viashino knew of the cracked pipes but deliberately left them unmended to bolster the rig's defenses.

item.name: Sulfuric Vapors
item.text: If a red spell would deal damage to a permanent or player, it deals that much damage plus 1 to that permanent or player instead.
item.flavorText: It was the dragons who first learned to chase their prey into the vapors before igniting them.

item.name: Thundering Giant
item.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
item.flavorText: The giant was felt a few seconds before he was seen.

item.name: Torch Song
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a verse counter on Torch Song. {2}{R}, Sacrifice Torch Song: Torch Song deals X damage to target creature or player, where X is the number of verse counters on Torch Song.

item.name: Viashino Outrider
item.text: Echo {2}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
item.flavorText: "Give thy ration to thy mount, if the road be long. So sayeth the bey."

item.name: Viashino Runner
item.text: Viashino Runner can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.
item.flavorText: "It moved this way, an' that way, an' then before I could stick it, it jumped over my head an' was gone." —Jula, goblin raider

item.name: Viashino Sandswimmer
item.text: {R}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, return Viashino Sandswimmer to its owner's hand. If you lose the flip, sacrifice Viashino Sandswimmer.
item.flavorText: Few swim in a place of such thirst.

item.name: Viashino Weaponsmith
item.text: Whenever Viashino Weaponsmith becomes blocked by a creature, Viashino Weaponsmith gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: Within the rig settlement, those who have mastered the making of weapons earn highest honor.

item.name: Vug Lizard
item.text: Mountainwalk Echo {1}{R}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)

item.name: Wildfire
item.text: Each player sacrifices four lands. Wildfire deals 4 damage to each creature.
item.flavorText: "Shiv hatched from a shell of stone around a yolk of flame." —Viashino myth

item.name: Abundance
item.text: If you would draw a card, you may instead choose land or nonland and reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a card of the chosen kind. Put that card into your hand and put all other cards revealed this way on the bottom of your library in any order.

item.name: Acridian
item.text: Echo {1}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
item.flavorText: The elves of Argoth were trained to ride these creatures, even when their mounts traveled upside-down.

item.name: Albino Troll
item.text: Echo {1}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.) {1}{G}: Regenerate Albino Troll.

item.name: Anaconda
item.text: Swampwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
item.flavorText: If you're smaller than the anaconda, it considers you food. If you're larger than the anaconda, it considers you a lot of food.

item.name: Argothian Elder
item.text: {T}: Untap two target lands.
item.flavorText: Sharpen your ears —Elvish expression meaning "grow wiser"

item.name: Argothian Enchantress
item.text: Shroud (This permanent can't be the target of spells or abilities.) Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, draw a card.

item.name: Argothian Swine
item.text: Trample
item.flavorText: In Argoth, the shortest route between two points is the one the swine make.

item.name: Argothian Wurm
item.text: Trample When Argothian Wurm enters the battlefield, any player may sacrifice a land. If a player does, put Argothian Wurm on top of its owner's library.

item.name: Blanchwood Armor
item.text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.) Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each Forest you control.
item.flavorText: "Braid her branches, life fulfilling Goddess loving, Goddess killing." —Citanul chant

item.name: Blanchwood Treefolk
item.flavorText: The massive Argivian attack on their rooted kindred was a declaration of war to the treefolk.

item.name: Bull Hippo
item.text: Islandwalk
item.flavorText: "How could you not hear it approach? It's a hippo" —Argivian commander

item.name: Carpet of Flowers
item.text: At the beginning of each of your main phases, if you haven't added mana to your mana pool with this ability this turn, you may add up to X mana of any one color to your mana pool, where X is the number of Islands target opponent controls.

item.name: Cave Tiger
item.text: Whenever Cave Tiger becomes blocked by a creature, Cave Tiger gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: The druids found a haven in the cool limestone tunnels beneath Argoth. The invaders found only tigers.

item.name: Child of Gaea
item.text: Trample At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Child of Gaea unless you pay {G}{G}. {1}{G}: Regenerate Child of Gaea.

item.name: Citanul Centaurs
item.text: Shroud (This permanent can't be the target of spells or abilities.) Echo {3}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)

item.name: Citanul Hierophants
item.text: Creatures you control have "{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool."
item.flavorText: From deep in the caves beneath the forest, the hierophants planned the druids' raids against the enemy.

item.name: Cradle Guard
item.text: Trample Echo {1}{G}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
item.flavorText: Mother, sleep / Dream our lives Our roots your soul / Our leaves your bed.

item.name: Crosswinds
item.text: Creatures with flying get -2/-0.
item.flavorText: Harbin's ornithopter had been trapped for two days within the currents of the storm. When the skies cleared, all he could see was a horizon of trees.

item.name: Elvish Herder
item.text: {G}: Target creature gains trample until end of turn.
item.flavorText: Before Urza and Mishra came to Argoth, the herders prevented their creatures from stampeding. During the war, they encouraged it.

item.name: Elvish Lyrist
item.text: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Elvish Lyrist: Destroy target enchantment.

item.name: Endless Wurm
item.text: Trample At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Endless Wurm unless you sacrifice an enchantment.
item.flavorText: Ages ago, a party of elves took cover to let one pass. They're still waiting.

item.name: Exploration
item.text: You may play an additional land on each of your turns.
item.flavorText: The first explorers found Argoth a storehouse of natural wealth—towering forests grown over rich veins of ore.

item.name: Fecundity
item.text: Whenever a creature is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, that creature's controller may draw a card.
item.flavorText: Life is eternal. A lifetime is ephemeral.

item.name: Fertile Ground
item.text: Enchant land Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds one mana of any color to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).
item.flavorText: The forest was too lush for the brothers to despoil—almost.

item.name: Fortitude
item.text: Enchant creature Sacrifice a Forest: Regenerate enchanted creature. When Fortitude is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Fortitude to its owner's hand.

item.name: Gaea's Bounty
item.text: Search your library for up to two Forest cards, reveal those cards, and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
item.flavorText: The forest grew back so quickly that lumbering machines were suspended in the treetops.

item.name: Gaea's Embrace
item.text: Enchant creature Enchanted creature gets +3/+3 and has trample. {G}: Regenerate enchanted creature.
item.flavorText: The forest rose to the battle, not to save the people but to save itself.

item.name: Gorilla Warrior
item.flavorText: The gorilla beat its chest and threw great handfuls of leaves into the air. It howled challenge and showed its teeth. The mechanical soldier, not understanding, simply killed it.

item.name: Greater Good
item.text: Sacrifice a creature: Draw cards equal to the sacrificed creature's power, then discard three cards.
item.flavorText: "We have more sprouts than they have hands." —Gamelen, Citanul elder

item.name: Greener Pastures
item.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, if that player controls more lands than each other player, the player puts a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.

item.name: Hawkeater Moth
item.text: Flying; shroud (This permanent can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
item.flavorText: Each day at dusk the birds above the canopy grow silent.

item.name: Hidden Ancients
item.text: When an opponent casts an enchantment spell, if Hidden Ancients is an enchantment, Hidden Ancients becomes a 5/5 Treefolk creature.
item.flavorText: The only alert the invaders had was the rustling of leaves on a day without wind.

item.name: Hidden Guerrillas
item.text: When an opponent casts an artifact spell, if Hidden Guerrillas is an enchantment, Hidden Guerrillas becomes a 5/3 Soldier creature with trample.

item.name: Hidden Herd
item.text: When an opponent plays a nonbasic land, if Hidden Herd is an enchantment, Hidden Herd becomes a 3/3 Beast creature.

item.name: Hidden Predators
item.text: When an opponent controls a creature with power 4 or greater, if Hidden Predators is an enchantment, Hidden Predators becomes a 4/4 Beast creature.

item.name: Hidden Spider
item.text: When an opponent casts a creature spell with flying, if Hidden Spider is an enchantment, Hidden Spider becomes a 3/5 Spider creature with reach. (It can block creatures with flying.)
item.flavorText: It wants only to dress you in silk.

item.name: Hidden Stag
item.text: Whenever an opponent plays a land, if Hidden Stag is an enchantment, Hidden Stag becomes a 3/2 Elk Beast creature. Whenever you play a land, if Hidden Stag is a creature, Hidden Stag becomes an enchantment.

item.name: Hush
item.text: Destroy all enchantments. Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

item.name: Lull
item.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn. Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

item.name: Midsummer Revel
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a verse counter on Midsummer Revel. {G}, Sacrifice Midsummer Revel: Put X 3/3 green Beast creature tokens onto the battlefield, where X is the number of verse counters on Midsummer Revel.

item.name: Pouncing Jaguar
item.text: Echo {G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
item.flavorText: One pounce, she's hungry—you die quickly. Two, she's teaching her cubs—you're in for a long day.

item.name: Priest of Titania
item.text: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool for each Elf on the battlefield.
item.flavorText: Titania rewards all who honor the forest by making them a living part of it.

item.name: Rejuvenate
item.text: You gain 6 life. Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

item.name: Retaliation
item.text: Creatures you control have "Whenever this creature becomes blocked by a creature, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn."
item.flavorText: A foul, metallic stench clogged Urza's senses. It was then he knew his brother was no more.

item.name: Sporogenesis
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a fungus counter on target nontoken creature. Whenever a creature with a fungus counter on it is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield for each fungus counter on that creature. When Sporogenesis leaves the battlefield, remove all fungus counters from all creatures.

item.name: Spreading Algae
item.text: Enchant Swamp When enchanted land becomes tapped, destroy it. When Spreading Algae is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Spreading Algae to its owner's hand.

item.name: Symbiosis
item.text: Two target creatures each get +2/+2 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: Although the elves of Argoth always considered them a nuisance, the pixies made fine allies during the war against the machines.

item.name: Titania's Boon
item.text: Put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control.
item.flavorText: When the winds rock the trees, listen for voices in the creaking of the trunks. If you hear your name, you are one of the Goddess's chosen.

item.name: Titania's Chosen
item.text: Whenever a player casts a green spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Titania's Chosen.
item.flavorText: "What do a hero and an arrow have in common? In times of war are many more made." —Elvish riddle

item.name: Treefolk Seedlings
item.text: Treefolk Seedlings's toughness is equal to the number of Forests you control.
item.flavorText: The year that the brothers landed on Argoth, the trees produced five times as many seeds as normal.

item.name: Treetop Rangers
item.text: Treetop Rangers can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.
item.flavorText: "If you can't catch them, cut the trees down from beneath them. Force them to fight on our terms." —Mishra

item.name: Venomous Fangs
item.text: Enchant creature Whenever enchanted creature deals damage to a creature, destroy the other creature.
item.flavorText: All the pain of the shattered forest contained in a single drop.

item.name: Vernal Bloom
item.text: Whenever a Forest is tapped for mana, its controller adds {G} to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).
item.flavorText: Many cultures have legends of a lush, hidden paradise. The elves of Argoth had no need of such stories.

item.name: War Dance
item.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a verse counter on War Dance.
Sacrifice War Dance: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of verse counters on War Dance.

item.name: Whirlwind
item.text: Destroy all creatures with flying.
item.flavorText: Urza tried to rule the air, but Gaea taught him that she controlled all the elements.

item.name: Wild Dogs
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if a player has more life than each other player, the player with the most life gains control of Wild Dogs. Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

item.name: Winding Wurm
item.text: Echo {4}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
item.flavorText: Entire trees were stripped of their bark and branches by the wurm's writhing path.

item.name: Barrin's Codex
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a page counter on Barrin's Codex. {4}, {T}, Sacrifice Barrin's Codex: Draw X cards, where X is the number of page counters on Barrin's Codex.

item.name: Cathodion
item.text: When Cathodion is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, add {3} to your mana pool.
item.flavorText: Instead of creating a tool that would be damaged by heat, the Thran built one that was charged by it.

item.name: Chimeric Staff
item.text: {X}: Chimeric Staff becomes an X/X Construct artifact creature until end of turn.
item.flavorText: A snake in the grasp.

item.name: Citanul Flute
item.text: {X}, {T}: Search your library for a creature card with converted mana cost X or less, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

item.name: Claws of Gix
item.text: {1}, Sacrifice a permanent: You gain 1 life.
item.flavorText: When the Brotherhood of Gix dug out the cave of Koilos they found their master's severed hand. They enshrined it, hoping that one day it would point the way to Phyrexia.

item.name: Copper Gnomes
item.text: {4}, Sacrifice Copper Gnomes: You may put an artifact card from your hand onto the battlefield.
item.flavorText: Start with eleven gnomes and a room of parts, and come morning you'll have ten and a monster the likes of which you've never seen.

item.name: Crystal Chimes
item.text: {3}, {T}, Sacrifice Crystal Chimes: Return all enchantment cards from your graveyard to your hand.
item.flavorText: As Serra was to learn, the peace and sanctity of her realm were as fragile as glass.

item.name: Dragon Blood
item.text: {3}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
item.flavorText: Fire in the blood, fire in the belly.

item.name: Endoskeleton
item.text: You may choose not to untap Endoskeleton during your untap step. {2}, {T}: Target creature gets +0/+3 for as long as Endoskeleton remains tapped.

item.name: Fluctuator
item.text: Cycling abilities you activate cost you up to {2} less to activate.
item.flavorText: Fiko summoned only atogs for three straight sessions. The tutor couldn't decide whether to punish his failure or praise his consistency.

item.name: Grafted Skullcap
item.text: At the beginning of your draw step, draw an additional card. At the beginning of your end step, discard your hand.
item.flavorText: "Let go your mind. Mine is fitter." —Gix, Yawgmoth praetor

item.name: Hopping Automaton
item.text: {0}: Hopping Automaton gets -1/-1 and gains flying until end of turn.
item.flavorText: Designed to carry equipment across rivers, the hopping automaton was soon pressed into service in the infantry.

item.name: Karn, Silver Golem
item.text: Whenever Karn, Silver Golem blocks or becomes blocked, it gets -4/+4 until end of turn. {1}: Target noncreature artifact becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost until end of turn. (That artifact retains its abilities.)

item.name: Lifeline
item.text: Whenever a creature is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, if another creature is on the battlefield, return the first card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.

item.name: Lotus Blossom
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a petal counter on Lotus Blossom. {T}, Sacrifice Lotus Blossom: Add X mana of any one color to your mana pool, where X is the number of petal counters on Lotus Blossom.

item.name: Metrognome
item.text: When a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard Metrognome, put four 1/1 colorless Gnome artifact creature tokens onto the battlefield. {4}, {T}: Put a 1/1 colorless Gnome artifact creature token onto the battlefield.

item.name: Mishra's Helix
item.text: {X}, {T}: Tap X target lands.
item.flavorText: The helix was the finest example of Mishra's campaign strategy: if he couldn't have Argoth, no one could.

item.name: Mobile Fort
item.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.) {3}: Mobile Fort gets +3/-1 until end of turn and can attack this turn as though it didn't have defender. Activate this ability only once each turn.

item.name: Noetic Scales
item.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, return to its owner's hand each creature that player controls with power greater than the number of cards in his or her hand.

item.name: Phyrexian Colossus
item.text: Phyrexian Colossus doesn't untap during your untap step. Pay 8 life: Untap Phyrexian Colossus. Phyrexian Colossus can't be blocked except by three or more creatures.

item.name: Phyrexian Processor
item.text: As Phyrexian Processor enters the battlefield, pay any amount of life. {4}, {T}: Put an X/X black Minion creature token onto the battlefield, where X is the life paid as Phyrexian Processor entered the battlefield.

item.name: Pit Trap
item.text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Pit Trap: Destroy target attacking creature without flying. It can't be regenerated.
item.flavorText: Yotian soldiers were designed to fight, not watch their feet.

item.name: Purging Scythe
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, Purging Scythe deals 2 damage to the creature with the least toughness. If two or more creatures are tied for least toughness, you choose one of them.

item.name: Smokestack
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a soot counter on Smokestack. At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices a permanent for each soot counter on Smokestack.

item.name: Temporal Aperture
item.text: {5}, {T}: Shuffle your library, then reveal the top card. Until end of turn, for as long as that card remains on top of your library, play with the top card of your library revealed and you may play that card without paying its mana cost. (If it has X in its mana cost, X is 0.)

item.name: Thran Turbine
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may add {1} or {2} to your mana pool. You can't spend this mana to cast spells.
item.flavorText: When Urza asked the viashino what it did, they answered: "It hums."

item.name: Umbilicus
item.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player returns a permanent he or she controls to its owner's hand unless he or she pays 2 life.
item.flavorText: It was the explorers' only tether to reality.

item.name: Urza's Armor
item.text: If a source would deal damage to you, prevent 1 of that damage.
item.flavorText: "Tawnos's blueprints were critical to the creation of my armor. As he once sealed himself in steel, I sealed myself in a walking crypt." —Urza

item.name: Voltaic Key
item.text: {1}, {T}: Untap target artifact.
item.flavorText: The key did not work on a single lock, yet it opened many doors.

item.name: Wall of Junk
item.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.) Whenever Wall of Junk blocks, return it to its owner's hand at end of combat. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)
item.flavorText: Urza saw the wall and realized that even if he tore every Phyrexian to pieces, they would still resist him.

item.name: Whetstone
item.text: {3}: Each player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
item.flavorText: To hone swords and dull minds. —Whetstone inscription

item.name: Wirecat
item.text: Wirecat can't attack or block if an enchantment is on the battlefield.
item.flavorText: Its purr is the sound of iron filings sliding down satin.

item.name: Worn Powerstone
item.text: Worn Powerstone enters the battlefield tapped. {T}: Add {2} to your mana pool.

item.name: Blasted Landscape
item.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

item.name: Drifting Meadow
item.text: Drifting Meadow enters the battlefield tapped. {T}: Add {W} to your mana pool. Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

item.name: Gaea's Cradle
item.text: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool for each creature you control.
item.flavorText: "Here sprouted the first seedling of Argoth. Here the last tree will fall." —Gamelen, Citanul elder

item.name: Phyrexian Tower
item.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Add {B}{B} to your mana pool.
item.flavorText: Living metal encasing dying flesh.

item.name: Polluted Mire
item.text: Polluted Mire enters the battlefield tapped. {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool. Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

item.name: Remote Isle
item.text: Remote Isle enters the battlefield tapped. {T}: Add {U} to your mana pool. Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

item.name: Serra's Sanctum
item.text: {T}: Add {W} to your mana pool for each enchantment you control.
item.flavorText: A fragile cocoon of dreaming will.

item.name: Shivan Gorge
item.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. {2}{R}, {T}: Shivan Gorge deals 1 damage to each opponent.
item.flavorText: Both forge and pyre.

item.name: Slippery Karst
item.text: Slippery Karst enters the battlefield tapped. {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool. Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

item.name: Smoldering Crater
item.text: Smoldering Crater enters the battlefield tapped. {T}: Add {R} to your mana pool. Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

item.name: Thran Quarry
item.text: At the beginning of the end step, if you control no creatures, sacrifice Thran Quarry. {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

item.name: Tolarian Academy
item.text: {T}: Add {U} to your mana pool for each artifact you control.
item.flavorText: The academy worked with time—until time ran out.
